explanation: To determine whether ahc_echo violates the MISRA rule forbidding direct or indirect self-calls, every function that ahc_echo calls (and any low-level helpers those callees use) must be inspected to see if any call path leads back to ahc_echo. The list above therefore includes: (1) all immediate callees of ahc_echo (each must be checked to see whether it calls ahc_echo directly or via other functions); (2) standard library functions used by ahc_echo (malloc, free, snprintf, strcmp) which might be wrappers in the codebase or replaced by project-specific implementations that could call back; and (3) a few helper/inner symbols referenced by the listed MHD_* wrappers (e.g. MHD_lookup_connection_value_n and the _cls variant used by the create-from-buffer-with-free-callback chain) because those inner helpers may contain further calls that could introduce an indirect call to ahc_echo. Inspecting the source of each listed symbol (and recursively any functions they call) is sufficient to determine whether any call chain from ahc_echo returns to ahc_echo (i.e., whether indirect recursion exists).
